source: U.S. Department of Labor - O*NET Database
description: Personal characteristics that can affect how well someone does a job

workStyles.name: Achievement/Effort
workStyles.definition: Job requires establishing and maintaining personally challenging achievement goals and exerting effort toward mastering tasks.

workStyles.name: Persistence
workStyles.definition: Job requires persistence in the face of obstacles.

workStyles.name: Initiative
workStyles.definition: Job requires a willingness to take on responsibilities and challenges.

workStyles.name: Leadership
workStyles.definition: Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.

workStyles.name: Cooperation
workStyles.definition: Job requires being pleasant with others on the job and displaying a good-natured, cooperative attitude.

workStyles.name: Concern for Others
workStyles.definition: Job requires being sensitive to others' needs and feelings and being understanding and helpful on the job.

workStyles.name: Social Orientation
workStyles.definition: Job requires preferring to work with others rather than alone, and being personally connected with others on the job.

workStyles.name: Self-Control
workStyles.definition: Job requires maintaining composure, keeping emotions in check, controlling anger, and avoiding aggressive behavior, even in very difficult situations.

workStyles.name: Stress Tolerance
workStyles.definition: Job requires accepting criticism and dealing calmly and effectively with high stress situations.

workStyles.name: Adaptability/Flexibility
workStyles.definition: Job requires being open to change (positive or negative) and to considerable variety in the workplace.

workStyles.name: Dependability
workStyles.definition: Job requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations.

workStyles.name: Attention to Detail
workStyles.definition: Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks.

workStyles.name: Integrity
workStyles.definition: Job requires being honest and ethical.

workStyles.name: Independence
workStyles.definition: Job requires developing one's own ways of doing things, guiding oneself with little or no supervision, and depending on oneself to get things done.

workStyles.name: Innovation
workStyles.definition: Job requires creativity and alternative thinking to develop new ideas for and answers to work-related problems.

workStyles.name: Analytical Thinking
workStyles.definition: Job requires analyzing information and using logic to address work-related issues and problems.
